decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The proposed screening would not provide an adequate screen and would allow opportunities for overlooking of surrounding properties. This would therefore lead to a significant loss of privacy to adjoining occupiers and would thereby be contrary to Policy ENV-B.1.1, H.4.1 of the Proposed Alterations Revised Deposit (2001) and ENV.1.1 and H.1.2 of the Adopted Unitary Development Plan (1996).
description: Following approval for demolition of existing buildings to rear and erection of a total of 9 buildings comprising 5 No. 2-4 storey buildings towards the north-eastern boundary, 3 no. 5-7 storey buildings in the central rear portion of the site and one two to two and a half storey buildings towards the rear portion of the south-western boundary.  These buildings to contain 11  three bedroom houses, 3 four bedroom houses, 8 five bedroom houses, 18 one bedroom flats, 77 two bedroom flats and 2 three bedroom flats with associated landscaping, parking, play area and the provision of publicly accessible open land to the rear. 36 of the housing units (blocks D, K and L) would be provided as affordable housing -details submitted pursuant to Condition 12 (screening for block c)  of approved Appeal Decision APP/FS540/A/02/1096952 dated 24/01/03.
